docs.abstract: Eleanora's Collision with Excursion Barge W. Sands in Hell Gate
docs.lead_paragraph: The barge Walter Sands, which was run into Saturday evening by the steamer Eleanora, was taken to Hoboken Sunday, and yesterday an examination of her was made by the manager of the Myers Excursion and Navigation Company, her owners, in company with a carpenter sent over by the Marine Steamship Company, owners of the Eleanora. The appearance of the boat accorded well with the description of her injuries given in THE TIMES of Sunday morning.

headline.main: THE HELL GATE COLLISION; BOTH SIDES TRYING TO SHIFT THE RESPONSIBILITY. INJURIES TO THE WALTER SANDS AND ELEANORA -- NEED OF A LAW AGAINST TOWING WITH A LONG HAWSER.

docs.abstract: Manhattan Sunk by Agnes Manning; Eleven Lost
docs.lead_paragraph: The iron steamship Manhattan of the Old Dominion Steamship Company was sunk on Wednesday morning at 5 o'clock about eight miles northeast of Fenwick Island Lightship, near Delaware Bay, of the coal schooner Agnes Manning, bound from Baltimore for New-York.

headline.main: RUN DOWN BY A SCHOONER; THE STEAMER MANHATTAN GOES TO THE BOTTOM. ELEVEN LIVES PROBABLY LOST--A COLLISION ON A CLEAR NIGHT--ONE OFTHE BOATS CAPSIZED.

docs.snippet: The screw steamer Rio Grande, the Mallory Line's Galveston boat, went for repairs to the East Ninth-street dock six weeks ago,and was to have been ready for sea in a day or two....

headline.main: FIRE ON A STEAMER.; THE RIO GRANDE OF THE MALLORY LINE HAS A NARROW ESCAPE.

docs.snippet: As the steamship Indiana, Capt. Boggs, was making her way down the Bay about 8:30 o'clock last night on her outward-bound trip for Antwerp, she was run into by a schooner whose name or identity could not be learned....

headline.main: COLLISION IN THE BAY.; AN UNKNOWN SCHOONER CUTS A HOLE IN THE STEAMSHIP INDIANA.

docs.snippet: Information received yesterday to the effect that Secretary Endicott of the War Department was about to enforce the removal of the wreck of the Atlas within 30 days, called forth a letter from Pim, Forwood  Co., agents of the Atlas Line, in which ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Information received yesterday to the effect that Secretary Endicott of the War Department was about to enforce the removal of the wreck of the Atlas within 30 days, called forth a letter from Pim, Forwood Co., agents of the Atlas Line, in which they repeated their statement that the work of removal is being carried on as fast as possible.

headline.main: WRECK OF THE ATLAS.; REPORT THAT THE WAR DEPARTMENT WILL ENFORCE ITS REMOVAL.

docs.snippet: NEWPORT, R.I., Dec. 31.--The steamer Bristol is a complete ruin. Only the upper part of the hull is above water, and it is surmounted by the half-burned wheelhouse. The framework of the walking beam is nearly all burned away, and the beam is kept ...
docs.lead_paragraph: NEWPORT, R.I., Dec. 31.--The steamer Bristol is a complete ruin. Only the upper part of the hull is above water, and it is surmounted by the half-burned wheelhouse. The framework of the walking beam is nearly all burned away, and the beam is kept in position by its connecting roads.

headline.main: THE BURNING OF THE BRISTOL.; SHE IS A COMPLETE RUIN--HER VALUATION AND INSURANCE.

docs.snippet: BALTIMORE, Md., March 21.--The bark Serene, Capt. Segerman, arrived this afternoon in tow of the tug Volunteer. She had been 65 days out from Rio Janeiro. On Monday night week she was in collision with the schooner Florence Rogers. The schooner wa...
docs.lead_paragraph: BALTIMORE, Md., March 21.--The bark Serene, Capt. Segerman, arrived this afternoon in tow of the tug Volunteer. She had been 65 days out from Rio Janeiro. On Monday night week she was in collision with the schooner Florence Rogers. The schooner was deserted by her Captain and mate, who came to Baltimore ...
